longtext: we are introducing the guanciale to a cold pan
we're then gonna turn the heat to medium
Once it is fully cooked, but not too crispy, we're gonna kill the heat
This is gonna cook the guanciale more slowly, and allow more of its fat to render out, which, in traditional Carbonara, is a good thing.
We're not adding any salt yet because guanciale can vary in saltiness, and we don't want to oversalt our dish.
